args:
Regina and Sandalphon work to piece together
reports from the apostles' investigation into
demon activity. But when they are summoned
by the cardinal and pope of the Ilian Church
of Grams, they find themselves placed under
arrest on suspicion of treason.
Mmm? It's one of Harle's ravens.
...It would appear he's successfully\nobtained it and is on his way back.
It must please you to know your plans\nare progressing so smoothly.

The traitor's brand has a way of slowing a
fellow down; I can't just walk about in
broad daylight as the apostles' leader
anymore.

An issue that I also feel all too acutely.
One slight slip, and I'll have the angels
and their apostles nipping at my heels.
It's all very exhausting.
Harle reports that the Alberian prince and\nhis little band are being kept busy at the\nSacred Tree.
So the only obstacles left before us are the\napostlesâ€”Basel's blasted pups.
Though if we pull their strings correctly,\nit might just give us the leverage we need\nto pry Basel from his seat as archbishop.

With him out of the picture, none would
remain who might challenge my authority.
Everything hinges on being rid of those
damned apostles.
I take it I have my orders, then?
I should think you fit for the job...unless\nyou still harbor a sentimental attachment\nto the old workplace?
I'm not the sort to pick up the pieces\nonce I cast something aside.
Good. Then let us begin the final phase\nof our operation.
A string of violent incidents involving demons\nhave recently taken place in the north.
It all began with the theft of a sealing stone from\nthe vaults of the Ilian Church in Grams.

Smuggled into South Grastaea, the stone emitted
a miasma that spread through multiple regions,
driving man and fiend alike into a frenzied
condition known as ï¼‚wroth.ï¼‚
In the town of Paradise, a woman calling herself\nMadame stole other people's memories in an\neffort to attain superhuman power.

Both cases were resolved through the hard work of
the angels and their apostles, but in the closing
moments of the Paradise case, it was revealed that
a traitor existed among our ranks.
This traitor was none other than Basileus,\nthe leader of the apostles.
Both the wroth incident and the events in Paradise\nwere merely experiments in his quest to revive\nSatan, a demon of tremendous power.

Since his betrayal, Basileus has lived as a fugitive,
hiding from his former peers as he works to free
fallen angelsâ€”mimicries of angels sealed away
by the magic of the stone.

And within those bodies crafted to resemble
angels sleep the Five Archdemons, creatures
said to have wrought untold devastation during
the ancient Empyrean War.

Though constructed as prisons, these angelic forms
spent eons steeping in the demons' fell miasma,
and its corrupting influence ultimately awakened
them as fallen angels.
Unleashed into the world by Basileus, they\nfollowed the dictates of their wanton desires until\nthe demons sealed within them finally manifested.

Though the angels and apostles were able to drive
them back for a time with the Prince's help, it is
unknown what became of the demons after that.
And while the investigation continues, no viable
leads on their whereabouts have been found.
...All right, that about sums things up.
I thought I might find you here. Looking\ninto the mimicries we collected?

Just finished, actually. Right now I'm
taking advantage of some downtime
to put together reports of the demon
situation on my tablet.
That's the device you crafted from a recipe\ndetailed in the Scrolls of Perdition, yes?

Also, it scares me that you consider
drafting reports to be a form of downtime.
You are going to burn yourself out if you
don't take some actual rest.
Says the angel who's always flying off on\nsome new task or another.

Regardless, I have a piece of good news:
Once the new tech I'm working on is done,
it'll cut your middle management workload
in half.
That is both very kind of you and wholly\nunnecessary. I've never once felt my work\nto be a burden.
Which means those perennial dark circles\nunder your eyes must be signs of utter\nexcitement and delight.
I suggest you stop worrying over my health\nand focus more on your own, Regina.

You are a nonstop frenzy of auditing,
analysis, negotiation, and strategy.
You should try cutting your own workload
before coming after mine.
Oh, you can be sure I'm always working\nto improve my own efficiency.
In fact, the new features I added to my\ntablet significantly cut down on the time\nit took to analyze those mimicries.
Ilia's legacy certainly lives up to its name.\nI'll bet nobody knew how to get it done like\nour Goddess did.
Then we should both take a page from Her\nbook and get back to it. I have a progress\nreport to share.
And you called ME a workaholic...\nBut all right. It's from Faris's unit,\nI presume?
Yes. They're dropping in on Father Mugra.\nThey're already in town, investigating his\npersonal affairs.
Last time, Faris said he was going to go\nthrough the storage logs at the vault and\ntry to discover who is backing Basileus.
Which means this priest must be a step on\nthe path to dragging said backer out into\nthe open.
Any words of wisdom you would like me\nto relay?
I'm more interested in sending backup\nthan advice. What are Nevin's people\ndoing at the moment?

They remain undercover in the military-
ruled state of Rozcimea, but we've had no
word from them since they first slipped
across the border.
Well, I suppose no news is good news,\nalthough keeping that low of a profile\nmakes it tough to send them as backup.
I know it is a bit early for our scheduled\ncheck-in, but shall I get in touch with\nRamiel and Gabriel regardless?
No, let's have them stay focused on their\ncurrent mission. We can ask them about\nreinforcements next time we talk.
Besides, I have a few things I need to look\ninto before we speak to Nevinâ€”or more\nspecifically, things I need to ask.
There are a few points I can't square in the\nreports that have come back so far.
First, there's the fact Ramiel and the others\nhad no idea about the sealing stone or the\nmimicries.
It was my understanding that you and the\nrest of the angels fought in the Empyrean\nWar when the demons were sealed away.

So how is it possible they were unaware
of the mimicries made to seal them,
or the stone that kept them within the
Otherworld?
Second question: Who crafted the mimicries\nin the first place?
At first, I assumed the copies were created\nby the Church from instructions in the\nScrolls of Perdition, much like my tablet.
But a closer inspection showed that the\ntechnology used in those mimicries is\nmarkedly different.
Which makes me wonder both who made\nthem and how they managed to do it.
If you wish to ask me something, Regina,\nyou may simply do so directly.
What do you know about all of this?
I fear I am unable to answer that question.
ï¼‚Unable,ï¼‚ is it? So in other words, yourâ€”
Regina and Sandalphon! You are both\nbeing called to answer for the crime of\nhigh treason against the Church!
Wait, TREASON?! Is this a joke?!
Save your questions for Cardinal Graht and\nthe Auspex. They are waiting for you.
I take it this is one of those invitations\nwe don't get to say no to.
We'll come back to our conversation at a\nlater date, Sandalphonâ€”and I intend to\nget some answers.
Grams\nCuria of the Ilian Church of Grams
What's the meaning of this nonsense?\nI demand an explanation!

Perhaps you would be so good as to tell
me why yet more angels and apostles
continue to follow Basileus in rebellion
against the Church?

The apostles Faris and Ryszardaâ€”as well
as the angels Uriel and Raphaelâ€”have
recently been arrested for the murder of
poor Father Mugra.

Additionally, we just received word that a
pack of assailants bearing the angels'
likeness have launched an unprovoked
attack on the state of Rozcimea.

It seems the apostles Nevin and Pinon
were in hiding there, as well as the angels
Ramiel and Gabriel. Quite the coincidence,
wouldn't you say?
And that's all it is. The fact they happened\nto be there on another mission is not proof\nthey incited the fallen angels to attack.

And yet the four of them have vanished.
Why sever communication and conceal
their whereabouts if they have nothing
to hide?
These are laughably baseless accusations\nthat no one in their right mind could\npossibly believe.

So says she who is accused of treason.
Yet it is the sole purview of Her Holiness
to decide truth from fiction, so I would
hear Pope Origa's thoughts on the matter.
Regina and Sandalphon, you will surrender\nyourselves into custody at once.
By your command, Holiness. Knights,\ndo your sacred duty and execute the\nwill of our esteemed Pope.
(So it's begun. Which means their next\ntarget will be...)
A few days before Regina and Sandalphon's arrest,\nin a certain Ilian church...
Well, well! It seems I finally made it back\nto this side.
Now all that's left is to enjoy my revenge\non him for banishing me to another world.
He'll surely realize I've returned by now,\ngiven all of his meddling with the chain\nof causality.

And while I'd like to wait and see what his
next move will be, it'll be SO much more
entertaining to head there and witness it
for myself! Aaaah ha ha ha ha!
